root.para: To check the reasonableness of its estimate of the optionâ€™s fair value, Martin imputed the yield to maturity (YTM) on the straight bonds. Assuming that the bonds have 8 years and 2 months to maturity, the imputed YTM on them is 12.54%. If Larson had straight bonds outstanding, Martin could compare the imputed YTM with the YTM of those bonds. However, Larson has no straight bonds outstanding, so Martin compared the imputed YTM to the YTM on straight bonds of similar credit quality (that is, BBB rated), which is approximately 12.5% to 13%. Therefore, Martin concluded that the allocation of the purchase price between the option and straight bonds is reasonable.
